body: Catherine Lott's spinster cousins lived in a sprawling, ancient farmhouse that was set among the boxy semidetached homes of southeastern Brooklyn as if dropped there by a tornado. On a visit nearly 40 years ago, when Ms. Lott was in her teens, the old women said they had something to share with her. ''They took me upstairs with great fanfare and
title: Marine Park Journal; Through a Walk-In Closet in Brooklyn, a Passage to Liberty

body: Five people were slain within eight hours Friday night and early yesterday in a spasm of violence that the police said began when a 17-year-old girl stabbed her sister-in-law in a fight over a telephone and ended with the mysterious killing of a man who was stabbed in the throat on a Brooklyn street. The spate of killing was unusual at a time when
title: 5 Killings in 8 Hours Seem to Defy the City's Low Crime Rates

body: An 18-year-old Brooklyn man was stabbed to death yesterday in the home he shared with his sister and his baby son, the authorities said. Lisa Alvarez, the sister of the victim, Jermaine Alvarez, discovered his body yesterday about 6:40 p.m., at their third-floor apartment on East 108th Street near Flatlands 10th Street in Canarsie. He had been
title: Man, 18, Is Fatally Stabbed in Brooklyn, and Police Seek a Motive

body: The Bronx and Brooklyn emerged from the last decade with a dubious distinction: According to an analysis of recent census data, more homeowners in those two boroughs spend more of their income on housing than people anywhere else in the country. The Bronx and Brooklyn jumped to the top of the list of United States counties ranked by the percentage
title: New York Homeowners Paying a Record Share for Housing

body: A 50-year-old Brooklyn woman returning home from work was fatally shot in the driveway of her home on Wednesday by a tenant who had just argued with her son, the police said yesterday. The tenant shot the woman, Maureen Greenidge, five times with a .45-caliber pistol before Ms. Greenridge could step out of her car in her driveway, on Trucklemans
title: Woman Is Fatally Shot Outside Her House in Brooklyn

body: Two more cases of West Nile virus have been reported in the city, the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene announced yesterday. A 59-year-old woman from the Bronx and a 66-year-old man from Brooklyn are hospitalized in stable condition. Spraying has been scheduled in northeast Queens from 8 o'clock tonight to 2 a.m. at Flushing Airport, Kissena
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Two More West Nile Cases

body: Two teenage girls were sexually abused in a public pool in Brooklyn last week, the police said, and a lifeguard responsible for their safety was arrested on Saturday and charged in the attack. The assault took place in the Glenwood Houses Pool in Flatlands last Monday, the police said. The lifeguard, Jonathan Beltre, 18, was charged with the sexual
title: Lifeguard, 18, Is Charged In Sex Abuse At Public Pool

body: A Brooklyn man was shot to death early yesterday morning while he was standing near a pier on the West Side of Manhattan where 300 people had gathered for a party on a lightship, the authorities said. No arrests have been made, and investigators said the motive for the shooting was unclear. The victim, Dane Plummer, 24, of 1336 East 54th Street,
title: Man Is Slain Outside Party On Docked Ship on Hudson

author: Michael Shapiro's next book, ''The Last Good Season: Brooklyn, the Dodgers and Their Final Pennant Race Together,'' is due out next year.
body: I was 4 years old when the Dodgers left Brooklyn, but unlike the team, I stayed. I never went to Ebbets Field. I never even saw it. I lived in Brooklyn until I was 21 and when I, too, finally left, I did so still believing that had the Dodgers not abandoned the borough for Los Angeles, Brooklyn would have been altogether different, not the flat,
title: MY BROOKLYN; The Team That's Filling the Void the Dodgers Left Behind

body: A state disciplinary panel found yesterday that a Brooklyn judge should be removed because he improperly sublet his apartment to his brother-in-law, used the rent money for child support and political contributions instead of holding it for the landlord, then intentionally tried to mislead the panel about his actions. The judge, Reynold N. Mason of
title: Panel Finds Brooklyn Judge Sublet Apartment Improperly
